item.title: Games That Should Have Gone Full Horror
item.description:
Despite the horror genre having been popular in the video game industry for more than two decades by this point, this doesn't mean that every developer has embraced horror with open arms. While there are many excellent horror games out there that contain all the spooks and scares that have become synonymous with the genre, some developers have created titles that may flirt with the idea of being truly horror-like, or even incorporate some creepy elements into the gameplay without diving headfirst into the genre as a whole.

Merging genres is always difficult, and while all the games listed below managed to do this extremely well, it does still feel as though they probably would have benefited from simply going all-in with the horror, creating an immersive and terrifying experience that will linger in players' minds long after the credits roll. That being said, while the games below are still well worth playing, it would have been great for fans to have seen them lean into the horrifying aspects of their gameplay and stories just a little more than they actually ended up doing.

Resident Evil 5

Too Much Action Turned Resident Evil 5 Into A Shooting Gallery

Resident Evil 5
18
7.4 /10
Released
March 5, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

To try and modernize the franchise so that it could appeal to a new audience, Capcom decided to fuse horror with action in Resident Evil 4 . With the enemies being a lot faster than zombies, along with a brand-new third-person camera angle, the game did an excellent job at balancing intensity and scares with high-speed action to keep players engaged at all times, and when looking at how well the game was received critically, it makes sense that Capcom would try to replicate this once again for Resident Evil 5 .

The truth is, many fans agree that the fifth mainline entry is where the series truly started to get carried away with the non-stop action. Because of how massive the swarms of enemies are, along with the addition of a second player, Resident Evil 5 can often feel like more of a mindless shooting gallery than an actual horror game, and this is an issue that only worsens as the game goes on. While Resident Evil 5 is still beloved for its story, lore, and important character moments, fans have long wondered how the game would have turned out if it had been a solo adventure that centered a lot more on horror, which the series has always been synonymous with.

Metroid Dread

Despite Being Darker, Dread Never Goes Too Far With Its Horror

Metroid Dread
8.5 /10
Released
October 8, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Animated Blood, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

There's always been a creepy and eerie vibe to the Metroid games, but in the lead-up to the release of Metroid Dread , Nintendo emphasized that the latest entry would be a lot scarier than what the players are used to. As players reverse through each of the giant hub worlds, they will eventually encounter lightning-fast enemies known as EMMIs, robotic guardians who will chase Samus to the ends of the Earth in an attempt to capture and kill her. There's no doubt that these sections can be pretty terrifying, but they only make up a fairly short portion of the game's overall runtime.

Most of the game is simple Metroidvania gameplay where players must use Samus' large variety of gadgets and weapons to navigate their way through each area. The game almost feels like it's desperate to go full-on with its horror, but pulls back at the last second, probably because Nintendo didn't want to get too carried away in order to protect their family-friendly image. Still, it's fun to theorize how Metroid Dead would have been received if it had been a true survival horror experience that encourages players to scavenge every last missile they can to try and survive the hellish nightmare.

Firewatch

Firewatch Already Has The Atmosphere On Point; It Just Needs A Few More Scares

Firewatch
9 /10
10
8.4 /10
Released
February 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Suggestive Themes, Nudity, Drug and Alcohol Reference, Strong Language
Powered by

Most people will find it difficult to describe what kind of game Firewatch even is, since it doesn't exactly fall into one specific genre. On a basic level, it could be classed as an adventure game, since players will spend most of their time wandering around a massive and vibrant natural landscape while talking with their new friend over the radio. As the game goes on, though, it starts to become clear that something sinister is going on behind the scenes, but outside, an animal making a loud noise here or there, there are not too many scares packed into the game to catch players off guard.

Firewatch feels like it was a perfect opportunity for the developers to get experimental with psychological horror. In a way, it could have been similar to something like Doki Doki Literature Club! , a game which seems innocent and cute on the surface, thanks to its visuals, but is actually a horrifying experience once players actually jump into the game. Because Firewatch never goes too far with its horror elements, though, it feels like a glaring missed opportunity, but with that being said, it's still always going to be a relaxing time wandering around a sun-drenched forest in the middle of nowhere.

The Stanley Parable

The Quirky Choice Game Is Very Sinister, But It Could Have Gone Even Further

The Stanley Parable
8.3 /10
Released
October 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Tobacco Reference
Powered by

At its core, The Stanley Parable is a game that essentially acts as a parody of video games in general, though despite being quite comical in its presentation, it is still hard to ignore the unnerving atmosphere that can be felt while playing through the game. As players navigate their way through each room, they will have a narrator telling them which way to go, though whether players decide to follow their orders or rebel is completely up to them.

Because of the lack of music and other characters it creates this sense of dread that lingers throughout. At the end of the day, though, The Stanley Parable is primarily focused on its clever narrative rather than horror, so despite setting the perfect foundation for a mind-bending psychological horror game, the developers instead decided to keep it fairly simple. If the decisions players were forced to make were a little more creepy and unnerving, it definitely would have raised the tension of the experience a lot more.

Control

Remedy Could Have Taken A Page Out Of Their Alan Wake Playbook When Creating Control

Control
9 /10
7.6 /10
Released
August 27, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Remedy is a development team that has proven time and time again that they are masters at creating horror games that can easily get under the players' skin through their monster designs and spine-chilling characters. When creating Control , though, it was clear that Remedy was instead prioritizing the otherworldly abilities and environments as the main focus of the gameplay, with horror taking more of a backseat.

With that being said, the developers still inserted at least a few tricks and techniques that they had learned from their previous horror games into Control , such as the oppressive lighting, which goes a long way in amplifying the eeriness of the gameplay. While the game ultimately didn't fully embrace horror, it's hard not to wonder how it would have played if Remedy had made the decision to insert even more terrifying elements to prevent players from ever feeling truly safe while playing.

Tomb Raider (2013)

Lara's Adventure Is Brutal, So Maybe Going All-In With Horror Would Have Worked

Tomb Raider
9 /10
8.3 /10
Released
March 5, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

After the series began gradually losing steam in the mid-2000s, developers Crystal Dynamics decided to give the Tomb Raider franchise a fresh reboot in 2013. This would become an action-adventure game where Lara, stranded on a mysterious island, must do everything she can to survive by using any weapons and supplies she gathers along the way. Anyone who has played this game will know that Lara's journey is a pretty brutal one, with the protagonist being shot, stabbed, and thrown around the environment countless times throughout the journey, giving the game a more mature and even slightly darker vibe that wasn't really associated with the previous entries.

Because the game also plays like a traditional third-person shooter, it means that it can also end up feeling like a shooting gallery, making it difficult to insert too much horror into the experience as a result. The franchise has never been a stranger to incorporating spooky, spiritual, and even mutant enemies into its games, and the same could have been applied to this 2013 reboot, where the horror could have come from the monsters that Lara would encounter. Though the game largely resorts to using regular human enemies, it seems as though the developers were teasing the idea of going into a more horror-filled direction, but also wanted to jump on the latest trend of third-person shooters, which were taking over the industry at the time.

item.title: These Games Aren’t Coming Soon, But They Are Worth Hyping Up
item.description:
Summary

  • Hollow Knight: Silksong finally has a release date — launching this September after years of waiting.
  • A swarm of long-teased games remain without firm dates — hype is strong, release timelines unclear.
  • Trailers teased diverse hits — horror, cyberpunk, open-world, clones, and lawsuits (e.g., Horizon lookalike).

At long last, Hollow Knight: Silksong has a release date. It was announced in 2019, and now it’s launching soon in September. There are a lot of games like this that are announced way too early, and the hype trains build so much momentum that they take on this god-like energy. Grand Theft Auto 6 is another example of this, and it’s hard for other games to compete against these cycles of hype.

While some games are fun to anticipate the few months or year before their release, others have unclear release windows. Still, based on gameplay or trailers shown, they already look well-established, meaning that they could release soon as a surprise. It may be dangerous to keep those hopes up, but t hese games are worth building hype around, even if their release may still be a ways off.

Darksiders 4

Will The Promise Finally Be Realized?

Darksiders 4
Action
Adventure
Systems
Developer(s)
Gunfire Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Since Darksiders debuted in 2010, fans have been waiting for the promise of Darksiders 4 . The original game ended with a tease of War’s fellow Horsemen coming to his aid, but every game after that was either a prequel or interquel, and while they were decent games, they disappointed by not living up to the first game's promise.

Darksiders 4 , which was just announced with a brief teaser in 2025, will let players choose to play as any one of the four Horsemen, as stated on the game’s website. No release date has been confirmed, but it’s safe to say, based on how brief this trailer was, that the game is probably a ways off, and it may be a while before players can enter the apocalypse once again.

DokeV

Pokemon In The City

DokeV
Action
Adventure
Open-World
Systems
Developer(s)
Pearl Abyss

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

DokeV was first teased in 2019, and the game hasn’t had much of a presence since then beyond a few more trailers and screenshot postings released in 2021. The developer, Pearl Abyss, is currently working on Crimson Desert , which is set to release in 2026. That’s probably why DokeV is taking so long, which could indicate that it will be released after the developer's next title.

As a refresher, DokeV looks a lot like Pokemon, except that everything shown so far has been taking place in cities with more exploration and activities showcased rather than battles between monsters. It's the kind of open-world approach to monster catching that could be a fun change of pace for a Pokemon clone.

Felt That: Boxing

The Muppets Go Dirty

Felt That: Boxing
Sports
Action
Fighting
Systems
Developer(s)
San Strings Studio

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Felt That: Boxing was one of the highlight announcement trailers shown off during Summer Game Fest’s event in 2025. It mixes The Muppets with boxing gameplay akin to Punch-Out , a series that Nintendo hasn’t touched since the Wii.

Even though the game's trailer looks like it was captured on film, all of the puppets were rendered with 3D graphics, which is incredible. No release date was included in the trailer, but the footage shown suggests that Felt That: Boxing has the potential to be the next Cuphead in terms of creativity.

ILL

Resident Evil’s Successor

ILL
Action
Horror
Survival Horror
Shooter
Systems
Developer(s)
Team Clout inc.

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

ILL's first teaser was revealed in 2021, as stated by the developer's YouTube account, and it recently got a new trailer during Summer Game Fest 2025. Team Clout has shown that they have come a long way from their original project, as the graphics look more realistic that back in 2021.

The creature designs, in particular, are original and horrific, especially the weird baby monsters, and the combat physics look brutal and satisfying. As the title suggests, ILL looks disgusting but, in the best possible way, one that all horror game fans will surely enjoy.

Light Of Motiram

Horizon Forbidden Clone

  • Developer : Polaris Quest
  • Publisher : Polaris Quest
  • Planned Release : Q4 2027

Light of Motiram was revealed in late 2024 with a lengthy trailer that detailed its world and provided some gameplay snippets. It looked a lot like the Horizon titles from Guerrilla Games, so much so that Sony went after the developer, Polaris Quest, in a 2025 lawsuit.

Those legal battles are still being fought, but fans interested in this open-world survival action game shouldn’t worry. After all, Palword was sued by Nintendo, and it is still available, even as a blatant Pokemon clone, so why shouldn’t Light of Motiram be allowed to exist as well? If the legal battles don’t slow things down, the game is set for release in 2027 according to its Steam page.

Neo Berlin 2087

Another Cyberpunk RPG

  • Developer : Elysium Game Studio
  • Publisher : Elysium Game Studio
  • Planned Release : TBA

Neo Berlin 2087 has been in development for a while, with its first trailer debuting in 2023. It has been a staple of Gamescom every year, with subtle progress in the animations shown in each new trailer.

It looks like a spiritual successor to the Deus Ex series and even features Elias Toufexis, who voiced Adam Jensen in the last two Deus Ex games. The gameplay and atmosphere are all there, too, with elements like gunplay, stealth takedowns, and cyberpunk backdrops. Now, if only the developer could nail down a release date.

Project Bloomwalker

If The Word "Project" Is In The Title, It's Not Coming Soon

  • Developer : Netmarble Neo
  • Publisher : Netmarble
  • Planned Release : TBA

Project Bloomwalker could be a year away, or a decade, as it’s hard to tell when a game has the word “Project” in the title. The game’s trailer was showcased during Gamescom 2025, and it’s so new that it doesn't even have a Steam page, despite being set for at least a PC release.

The game looks remarkably like a Studio Ghibli film, specifically Howl’s Moving Castle , as there is sentient fire and a moving alchemist stand. It’s not the first game to be inspired by Studio Ghibli, and it won’t be the last, but this RPG-like sim looks promising all the same.

The Witcher 4

It’s Ciri’s Time

The Witcher 4
Action RPG
Open-World
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

CD Projekt Red does not have the best track record when it comes to announcing games and then delivering them in a timely manner. Cyberpunk 2077 was first teased in 2013, and it was released in 2020. Granted, in that span of time, the developer released several games based on The Witcher, so it's not like they were radio silent.

This is all to say that The Witcher 4 could be a long way off, but the developer has shown it off twice in a relatively short amount of time between its December debut, followed by a 2025 tech demo trailer. It's not much to go on, but it's a new Witcher game, so it doesn't take much to start the hype machine rolling. Whenever it comes, Ciri fans will be happy.

item.title: How to Solve the Light Puzzle in Silent Hill f (Worship Hall)
item.description:
While experiencing the chilling tale of Hinako in Silent Hill f , players will also encounter mind-boggling puzzles that require keen-eyed observation. After completing the Middle School area, Hinako will reach the Worship Hall area of the Dark Shrine. Here, you'll need to solve two puzzles to proceed to the final room ahead. One of these is the Light Puzzle, which will require you to turn the Rabbit and the Fox statues in a way to level the cages in the room.

How to Solve the Light Puzzle in Silent Hill f (Worship Hall)

The Light puzzle is one of two puzzles that are required to progress through the Dark Shrine's Worship Hall area in Silent Hill f . The hallway that leads to the puzzle is to the right, and players will be able to access it after interacting with the fox statue to the left of the middle door.

After making it through the lantern-lit rooms and clearing a path to the light puzzle room, players will come face to face with Sakuko, or at least a memory of hers that's materialized in the Dark Shrine realm. Picking up a piece of paper from the table in front of Sakuko's cell will start the Light puzzle.

Depending on the difficulty, the clue and solution to the light puzzle will vary from player to player. The piece of paper will mainly hint at the direction both the rabbit and fox statues should be facing to level the cages in the room. Those cages must be leveled for Hinako to retrieve two important items that are required to solve this puzzle.

So, here's the solution to the Light Puzzle in Silent Hill f for all difficulties.

Players will need to interact with the statues multiple times to set them in the desired direction. Also, the direction of the Statues mentioned below is in terms of Hinako facing away from Sakuko's cage.

Puzzle Difficulty

Statues on the Left

Statues on the Right

Story

The fox should face to the right .

The rabbit should face to the left .

The fox should face to the right .

The rabbit should face to the left .

Hard

The fox should face to the left .

The rabbit should face to the right .

The fox should face to the left .

The rabbit should face to the right .

Lost in the Fog

The fox should face to the left .

The rabbit should face to the right .

The fox should face to the left .

The rabbit should face to the left .

Once you've aligned the fox and rabbit statues correctly, the cages in the room will be leveled. Look into the open cages to get the Restraint Lampshade and the Talon Lampshade .

Return to Sakuko's cell and cover both the lanterns in this area with the lampshades. Doing this will release the latch on the key, allowing players to receive a chilling cutscene and the White Rabbit Emblem Key . This will complete the Light puzzle in Silent Hill f , and players will be able to use the key on the main fox statue in the Worship's Hall Grand area to open one of the doors.

9.3 /10
10 /10

Silent Hill f

item.title: Splatoon 3 Announces Halloween Splatfest
item.description:
Splatoon 3 is bringing back its seasonal Halloween Splatfest, which it refers to as Splatoween. Fans will be able to participate in a 48-hour Splatfest to determine which spooky theme reigns supreme in Splatoon 3 .

Splatfests are one of the most exciting elements of the Splatoon series. While repeat themes don't tend to inspire as much enthusiasm from fans, they do pose an interesting opportunity to shake up the results of prior Splatfests. Between players changing teams from the original run to matches shaping up differently due to weapon adjustments since the first version, there's a lot of room for variance.

Splatoon 3 Brings Halloween Splatfest Back

Splatoon 3 has now announced the return of the Halloween Splatfest, aka Splatoween, which will begin on October 24 at 6 pm PT/9pm ET. The event will run for a full 48 hours, coming to an end on October 26 at the same time. This run will be a repeat of the theme from Splatoon 3 's first Halloween Splatfest, posing the question of which spooky creature would make the best friend: zombies, skeletons, or ghosts. Players can't yet officially choose their teams, as the game usually allows players to start doing so about a week before a Splatfest.

Splatoon 3 's last run of this particular Splatfest theme saw Team Ghost take home the win. However, that doesn't mean that the same result will hold up this time around. In addition to players potentially changing how they play and which teams they join, Splatoon 3 Splatfests were retooled with the 7.0 update, altering how match wins, votes, and Conch Shells are calculated towards the winning score. For example, the first time this theme was held, Team Zombies originally ended up with 0 points overall. However, Team Zombie landed in second place in two categories, which would have rewarded it with 105 points if it had used the current judging system. While this wouldn't have been enough to significantly change the outcome, the winner this time around is anyone's guess.

Like all Splatfests, Splatoween's return is likely to be popular in the game, though many fans' attention may remain focused on Splatoon Raiders . The spin-off game featuring the idols of Splatoon 3 , as well as a new playable character, was announced for the Nintendo Switch 2, but nothing has been said regarding it since. Given Nintendo still has major hitters arriving for its consoles in 2025, like Kirby Air Riders , Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment , and the long-awaited Metroid Prime 4: Beyond , Splatoon fans may want to curb their expectations and not expect anything significant to be announced for Splatoon Raiders until 2026.

7.2 /10

Splatoon 3

item.title: How to Get Free Daft Punk Cosmetics in Fortnite
item.description:
Fortnite and Daft Punk have collaborated for a major music collab in the virtual world. Various types of cosmetics and Daft Punk items were revealed for this collaboration, but that was only part of it. Another exciting part of it is the Daft Punk experience, which is an upcoming in-game concert that will take place on the Battle Royale island.

Besides the Item Shop cosmetics, players get a free Daft Punk item in Fortnite but it will only be available for a very limited time. If fans don't want to miss it, they should mark their calendars.

How to Get the Free Daft Punk Kicks in Fortnite

How to Claim the Waveform Walkers

Fortnite is giving away free Daft Punk-themed kicks called the Waveform Walkers. The Waveform Walkers kicks is a reward exclusive to players who watch the Daft Punk experience live in Fortnite .

To get the Waveform Walkers in Fortnite , players have to attend the Daft Punk experience on Saturday, September 27, between 2 PM and 3 PM ET . Gamers who don't want to miss it should enter the live event queue 30 minutes before the event begins.

Players who prefer to watch these events on stream and tend to skip experiencing them in-game should at least boot up their game so they can guarantee that they get the free kicks.

When Will the Waveform Walkers Be Available in Fortnite?

Even though the Daft Punk experience takes place on September 27, and this is when players will have to log in to ensure that they get the kicks, gamers won't actually receive the cosmetic on the same day. The Waveform Walkers kicks will be granted to players who watched the Daft Punk experience one week after its premiere .

Therefore, gamers shouldn't expect the kicks to immediately be added to their in-game lockers once the Daft Punk experience comes to an end. However, if they notice that it's been a week and there is still no sign of them in their inventory, then it might be time to contact Epic Games.

Fortnite cosmetics are not exclusive to events, so gamers who miss out on the experience will most likely be able to purchase the Waveform Walkers in the Item Shop at a later date.

294
8.9 /10

Fortnite
